div.p: Greetings. My godfather, Mr. Haller, told me, dearest godfather in the Lord, Bullinger, what my nephew Nicolaus, from my brother, intended to do with you, and from what danger you rescued him through your intervention. He is in peril and, unless he repents, he will utterly perish by his own fault.

I raised him from boyhood with the care and diligence I could muster as a father; he was unwilling, when he could, to apply himself to letters, but continually aspired to some manual craft. Compelled, I assigned him at my expense to the art of surgery and for this purpose sent him to Augsburg and recommended him to friends I have there.
